bug.author: ColinFinck
bug.summary: Build fails with C++11 enabled in MinGW-w64 5.3.0 - Different conditionals in Detection Based Tracker
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV => 3.1 Operating System / Platform => Windows 32 Bit Compiler => MinGW-w64 5.3.0 (as shipped with Qt 5.7)
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
In an attempt to compile OpenCV 3.1 with the Qt 5.7-bundled 32-Bit MinGW-w64 5.3.0 compiler and proper Qt GUI bindings, I needed to do "set CXXFLAGS=-std=gnu++11" prior to compiling. Otherwise, build fails at the Qt bindings, because latest Qt 5.7 can only be built with C++11 enabled. With this option though, build fails at 74% in detection_based_tracker.cpp. This code is only conditionally compiled and while I cannot totally figure out what platforms you want to exclude, the conditions should at least be the same in detection_based_tracker.cpp and detection_based_tracker.hpp. Currently, detection_based_tracker.cpp checks for __cplusplus > 199711L and detection_based_tracker.hpp wants __cplusplus > 201103L. In my opinion, this needs to be changed to > 199711L in the .hpp file. It fixes the problem for me. <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
mkdir mingw_build cd mingw_build set CXXFLAGS=-std=gnu++11 cmake -D WITH_QT=ON -D WITH_OPENGL=ON -G "MinGW Makefiles" ../sources mingw32-make

comments.comment: Please provide a pull request with the suggested fix, so that this issue can be tracked more easily.
Can I work on this issue?

Can I work on this issue?
Of course, anyone is free to supply a pull request to try and solve open issues.
